channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 2025’s Best Phones Were Also Its Wackiest
item.description: If anything, iPhones and Pixels are practically vanilla. The next generation is thinner, more transparent, and folds in half. That’s a good thing.

item.title: The Gloves Are Off in the Fight for Your Right to Repair
item.description: This year, the right-to-repair movement got a boost from—surprisingly—big tech, tariffs, and economic downturn. But the companies controlling who fixe...

item.title: Tuft & Needle Promo Codes: 20% Off | December 2025
item.description: Save 20% on best-selling mattresses with our top Tuft & Needle coupon codes.

item.title: How a $200 Fake Fireplace From Home Depot Soothed My Soul
item.description: Research shows that watching a simulated fire may have real psychological benefits.

item.title: ‘Wolf DNA’ Lurks in Many Modern Dog Breeds
item.description: Although wolf-canine interbreeding has been considered extremely rare, the latest research shows that many present-day canines carry a small amount of...

item.title: Nvidia to license AI chip challenger Groq’s tech and hire its CEO
item.description: With Groq on its side, Nvidia is poised to become even more dominant in chip manufacturing.

item.title: Waymo explains why its robotaxis got stuck during the SF blackout
item.description: The company also said its robotaxis navigated more than 7,000 dark stoplights successfully on Saturday.

item.title: Waymo is testing Gemini as an in-car AI assistant in its robotaxis
item.description: Waymo is testing a Gemini-powered in-car AI assistant, per findings from a 1,200-line system prompt. The assistant can answer general knowledge questi...

item.title: The year data centers went from backend to center stage
item.description: Data centers are no longer the boring tech issue they once were.

item.title: The European startup market’s data doesn’t match its energy — yet
item.description: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.
